name: General Knowledge
description: A mix of pop culture, science, history, and internet trivia.
author: Schooled

homeroom.prompt: Which language is used to style web pages?
In Rocket League, what do you hit into the goal?

pop_quiz.prompt: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
What is the capital of Australia?
In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?
What planet is known as the Red Planet?
Which film franchise features a character called Groot?
What is the square root of 144?

field_trip.prompt: How many bones are in the adult human body?
Which country has the most time zones?
Which ancient wonder was located in Alexandria?
What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Which classical composer was deaf when he wrote his 9th Symphony?

wager_round.hint: Only ONE option can be true — but more than one can sound right.
wager_round.prompt: A jar has 3 red, 2 blue, and 1 green marble. You draw 2 marbles without replacement. Which outcome is MOST likely?
wager_round.extraHint: Count combinations: total pairs = C(6,2). Compare how many pairs match each option.

wager_round.hint: Think about what changes (and what doesn’t) when you add the same number twice.
wager_round.prompt: If x is an integer and 2x + 1 is even, which must be true?
wager_round.extraHint: Parity check: 2x is always even, so 2x+1 is always odd.

wager_round.hint: One option is a common misconception.
wager_round.prompt: Which statement about seasons on Earth is correct?
choices: Seasons happen because Earth is closer to the Sun in summer
Seasons happen mainly because of Earth’s tilt
Seasons happen because the Sun’s heat output changes each month
Seasons only happen in the Northern Hemisphere
wager_round.extraHint: Seasons come from the angle of sunlight and day length changes over the year.

wager_round.prompt: You flip a fair coin 4 times. What is the probability of getting exactly 2 heads?
wager_round.extraHint: Use the binomial count: C(4,2) ways to place 2 heads, each sequence has probability (1/2)^4.

wager_round.hint: Read carefully: it’s about what MUST be true, not what is likely.
wager_round.prompt: If all Blips are Blops, and some Blops are Blaps, which must be true?
wager_round.extraHint: Translate carefully: “some Blops are Blaps” means at least one Blap is also a Blop.

wager_round.hint: Two of these look similar, but only one is truly a protocol.
wager_round.prompt: Which of these is a network protocol (not a programming language or platform)?
wager_round.extraHint: A protocol is a set of communication rules (often like HTTP/FTP), not a language/framework/runtime.

boss_fight.prompt: What year was the first iPhone released?
Which element has the atomic number 1?
In chess, which piece can only move diagonally?
What is the smallest country in the world by area?
What is the speed of light in km/s (approximately)?
